subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: Shane Mosley’s fight with Zab Judah on May 31 in Las Vegas was canceled after Judah injured his arm in a fall. Judah (36-5, 25 knockouts), the former undisputed welterweight champion, severely cut his right forearm and needed 50 stitches to close the wounds, which will keep him out of training for four weeks. Mosley (44-5, 37 knockouts), lost a competitive unanimous decision to Miguel Cotto in his last fight on Nov. 10.
